question: 7 (b)
sols_html:
To classify the critical points, we use the second derivative test.

From \(f_x = ye^y + x\), we compute:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle f_{xx} = 1\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle f_{xy} = e^y + y e^y = e^y (1+y)\end{aligned}\]

From \(f_y = xe^y (y+1)\), we find:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle f_{yy} = x [e^y (y+1) + e^y] = xe^y (y+2)\end{aligned}\]

Hence,

\[\begin{aligned} D = f_{xx} f_{yy} - f_{xy}^2 = xe^y (y+2) - e^{2y}(1+y)^2\end{aligned}\]

  • At (0,0), we find \(D = 0-1 = -1 < 0\). As \(D < 0\), we have a saddle point.

  • At \((e^{-1},-1)\), we find \(D = e^{-2} -0 > 0\), so there is either a local maximum or local minimum. From \(f_{xx}(e^{-1},-1) = 1 > 0\), it must be a local minimum.
